body:
This is a partial duplicate of an [older issue](https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/issues/939), but I'll close the old one and leave this one open, since this is more detailed and somewhat easier to find. Just a couple of comments on the proposed API:
- I prefer `abort()` as the name of the new function, as proposed in the other issue. It's makes it more clear that we're aborting the whole test. `exit()` also has connotations of immediate termination, while k6 actually has to perform some housekeeping when it aborts tests, like sending latest metrics to collectors, etc.
- This likely shouldn't be a global function, rather it would probably be better if users have to import it as `import { abort, sleep } from "k6";`

issue.title: Refactor the collectors/outputs

labels.name: evaluation needed
labels.description: proposal needs to be validated or tested before fully implementing it in k6

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
It's becoming clear that the current [`Collector` interface](https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/blob/bdd417e8a4206c6bbbef36d7ce7bea48f34a0804/lib/collector.go#L32-L72) isn't very fit for purpose. It is a poor fit for a lot of the outputs ([[1]](https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/blob/bdd417e8a4206c6bbbef36d7ce7bea48f34a0804/stats/statsd/common/collector.go#L102-L108), [[2]](https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/blob/bdd417e8a4206c6bbbef36d7ce7bea48f34a0804/stats/kafka/collector.go#L96-L107), [[3.1]](https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/blob/master/stats/json/collector.go#L78-L82), [[3.2]](https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/blob/bdd417e8a4206c6bbbef36d7ce7bea48f34a0804/stats/json/collector.go#L136-L143), [[4]](https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/blob/bdd417e8a4206c6bbbef36d7ce7bea48f34a0804/stats/influxdb/collector.go#L190-L196), [[5]](https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/pull/1067)), it leads to some code duplication and makes correctly writing new thread-safe outputs relatively difficult, and it also doesn't offer enough functionality for more complicated outputs (https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/issues/1074). The same thing even has multiple names - what we call `Collector`s in the code live in the [`stats` folder](https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/tree/master/stats) and are presented as ["outputs"](https://docs.k6.io/docs/results-output) to users...

Additionally, the thresholds and the end-of-test summary are basically somewhat special-purpose outputs... They ingest metrics and do some calculations on them - the summary just spews the aggregated results at the end of the test, while thresholds do some calculations and potentially abort the test execution... They are enabled by default, but can be disabled by users. I'm not sure if it makes sense to refactor them into outputs for just a marginal improvement of code quality, but it should at least be investigated...

I think that when we're investigating the telegraf integration (https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/issues/1064), we should also investigate their output pipeline architecture. Since their main job is dealing with metrics, there are probably things we can learn from them... 

Other somewhat related issues: https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/issues/917, https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/issues/570, https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/issues/587, https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/issues/1001, https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/issues/743, https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/issues/572, https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/issues/355, https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/issues/351

body:
Since we now have the powerful scenario's. Would it be possible to abort a scenario so the next one starts?

That would be a massive win for me.

issue.title: How to exit the K6 script loop anywhere I want?

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body: Hi, as we know, the k6 script will loop until the running time is expired, but if I want to exit the script when the exit condition is triggered, then how to exit the script before running time is expired?

issue.title: Core changes for `k6/x/execution` JS module

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
These are core changes needed for the [`k6/x/execution` JS module](https://github.com/k6io/xk6-execution).

Initially the module was part of core as well, but we decided to extract it into an extension to be able to quickly iterate on the API. See the JS usage and example in the extension repo.

This also inadvertently fixes the segmentation of iterations for the `ramping-arrival-rate` executor. See https://github.com/k6io/k6/pull/1863#discussion_r655969147.

Part of #1320

body:
> Since we now have the powerful scenario's. Would it be possible to abort a scenario so the next one starts?
> 
> That would be a massive win for me.

I agree with this, this would be a total win here also! Something like `abortScenario`. My scenario needs to end once all users have received a specific HTTP response from the API we are testing, we are testing creation load in our backend.

@basickarl, aborting a single scenario would be a lot more complicated in the distributed/cloud execution mode, so it's out of scope for this issue. If you want, feel free to create a new issue with details of your specific use case.
